idiom: Не все те золото, що блищить
literal_meaning: Not all that glitters is gold.
example: Don't be fooled by the shiny packaging; не все те золото, що блищить.

literal_meaning: To have a head on one's shoulders.
example: She always makes wise decisions; she definitely has a head on her shoulders.

figurative_meaning: To gossip or speak negatively about someone when they are not present.
example: It's not nice to говорити за спиною; you should confront them directly.

figurative_meaning: To keep something confidential or hidden.
example: I trust you to тримати в секреті my plans until I'm ready to share.

literal_meaning: To get back on your feet.
figurative_meaning: To recover from difficulties or setbacks.
example: After losing his job, it took him a while to піднятися на ноги again.

literal_meaning: To throw stones into someone else's garden.
figurative_meaning: To criticize or blame others while avoiding responsibility.
example: It's easy to кида́ти каміння в чужий город when you're not involved in the situation.

figurative_meaning: To try to please two parties at once, often leading to failure.
example: You can't keep сидіти на двох стільцях; you need to choose a side.

figurative_meaning: To deceive or manipulate someone easily.
example: He always водить за носа his friends with his tall tales.

figurative_meaning: To reach rock bottom or the lowest point in life.
example: After all the failures, he finally felt like he had пробив дно.
